name: Squippy's Escape
description:
Squippy's Escape is a quick, tough platformer. Guide Squippy to the exit, avoiding the hazards (spikes, mostly) as you make your way through five levels. But don't worry--even if Squippy dies, he jumps right back into the action!

Squippy's Escape is my first game project, and was mostly intended as a vehicle to familiarize myself with development in GameMaker: Studio and GML, and to learn the mechanics and considerations of making a 2D platformer. As someone who chronically abandons projects, another specific goal I had was to see it to the end and create a complete, polished product that I would be proud to show off. So here it is! I hope you check it out and enjoy!

(P.S. My current record time is 1:39.20, can you beat it?)

Simply unzip the .zip and run the .exe!

This game should run on just about any semi-modern Windows machine, but if you run into any performance problems please leave a comment below.

  • ARROW KEYS to move/jump/drop-through
  • P to pause
  • M to mute/unmute
  • F to toggle fullscreen (in main menu or pause menu)
  • R in-game to reset game (don't press accidentally!)
  • ESC at any time to quit
  • Design, programming, art, sound, music (Intro Theme): Dan Thompson
  • Music (Main Theme, Level 5 Theme, End Theme): Callan Clarke
  • Thanks to Callan, Sean and Isaac for playtesting
  • And thanks to Rachel for making me a lovely t-shirt with Squippy on it
